channel.description: Recent content in TechTrends on Compile My Mind

item.title: What’s New in Java 25 (JDK 25)
item.description: Java 25 (JDK 25) is here — and it’s an LTS release. That means most vendors will support it for years, and many teams will plan upgrades from JDK 17 or 21 directly to 25. In this post, I’ll walk through the highlights that matter in real projects: language changes, concurrency improvements (Project Loom), runtime and GC work, observability via JFR, security/crypto, and AOT ergonomics.
